post.summary: Returns the cards, fees and limits associated with a card holder.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call retrieves all the details associated with a card holder.

ch_client_code.description: Unique identifier of a consumer. If this field is provided, the virtual account will be trated as a consumer account, belonging to a consumer of the corporation with provided corporate_id.

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of the individual, formatted yyyy-mm-dd.

mobile_no.description: Mandatory for 3D- Secure e-commerce payments. Mobile number of the individual.

language.description: The communication language requested by the consumer following ISO 639-1 language code. E.g. en - English.

tel_no.description: The primary household landline telephone number of the consumer.

tel_ext.description: Country Code extension for landline telephone number.

miduserid.description: Modirum User ID for 3D Secure SDK users

email.description: The email address of the individual.

mobile_ext.description: Country Code extension for mobile telephone number.

mobile_no.description: Mandatory for 3D- Secure e-commerce payments. Mobile number of the individual.

mobile_ext.description: Country Code extension for mobile telephone number.

card_visible_number.description: Characters showing part of the PAN (first 4 characters * last 4 characters)

card_network.description: Card Netwrok provider, VISA or MASTERCARD

expiry_renew.description: 0: do not renew at card expiration 1: automatic renewal at card expiration

profile.description: Profile of limits, velocities, and fees of the virtual account. Not available on all packages.

card_sequence.description: If design of the card is asking for sequence, then a 3 digit number will be generated. This number is unique for any card of the card holder.

wallet_client_code.description: Code of the account to be used to authorise transactions against. The virtual account reference linked to the debit card. Not available on all the markets.

card_type.description: V (uppercase V) for virtual P (uppercase P) for physical

card_exp_date.description: The expiry date of the card (format yyyy-mm-dd).

deny_mcc.description: Comma separated list of MCC codes that should be denied. To define a range of MCC, separate the first and last MCC by a minus. Not available on all the markets

card_line_4.description: Free text field. For line 4 variable data. A regular expression for control will put in place.

design_id.description: The card design reference of the card that is being created. The relevant designs will be provided by Bankable.

corporate_id.description: Corporate Identity. If set, the future virtual account will be attached to the corporate. Otherwise, it will be attached to the default coporate of the distributor. Every virtual account that gets created will be associated to a corporate Identity.

card_name.description: The name to appear on the card. If omitted then the card name will be composed by: <first_name><><last_name> or if abbreviation is needed <first letter of first_name><><last_name>. The field length can vary depending on the card design and is also restricted to a maximum of 21 if the provider is Marqeta.

deny_service.description: Comma separated list of services (authorisation transaction types) that should be denied for the card: 0 - Sale (Goods & services) 1 - Cash 9 - Sale with cashback Not available on all markets

ch_client_code.description: Unique identifier of a consumer. If this field is provided, the virtual account will be trated as a consumer account, belonging to a consumer of the corporation with provided corporate_id.

post.summary: Applies a fee to a card account. The fee is credited to the specified virtual accountand the card account is debited. Fees will only be charged to the card account if the balance of the card account is sufficient. The endpoint allows the caller to a reason/description for the fee.

parameters.description: A successful call applies a fee to a card account

deny_mcc.description: Comma separated list of MCC codes that should be denied. To define a range of MCC, separate the first and last MCC by a minus. Not available on all the markets

card_line_4.description: Free text field. For line 4 variable data. A regular expression for control will put in place.

expiry_renew.description: 0: do not renew at card expiration 1: automatic renewal at card expiration

profile.description: Profile of limits, velocities, and fees of the virtual account. Not available on all packages.

card_type.description: V (uppercase V) for virtual P (uppercase P) for physical

card_exp_date.description: The expiry date of the card (format yyyy-mm-dd).

design_id.description: The card design reference of the card that is being created. The relevant designs will be provided by Bankable.

corporate_id.description: Corporate Identity. If set, the future virtual account will be attached to the corporate. Otherwise, it will be attached to the default coporate of the distributor. Every virtual account that gets created will be associated to a corporate Identity.

tel_no.description: The primary household landline telephone number of the consumer.

name.description: Name of the device the token is linked to.

location.description: Latitude and Longitude of the device.

load_curr.description: Currency code of the virtual account. ISO 3 characters code. Mandatory if virtual_account_ref is provided but only for virtual cards.

expiry_renew.description: 0: do not renew at card expiration 1: automatic renewal at card expiration

profile.description: Profile of limits, velocities, and fees of the virtual account. Not available on all packages.

deny_mcc.description: Comma separated list of MCC codes that should be denied. To define a range of MCC, separate the first and last MCC by a minus. Not available on all the markets

load_amount.description: Amount from the virtual account to load onto the card. Decimal separator: "." (point) Thousand separator: none Mandatory if virtual_account_ref is provided. Only for Virtual Cards

card_line_4.description: Free text field. For line 4 variable data. A regular expression for control will put in place.

design_id.description: The card design reference of the card that is being created. The relevant designs will be provided by Bankable.

corporate_id.description: Corporate Identity. If set, the future virtual account will be attached to the corporate. Otherwise, it will be attached to the default coporate of the distributor. Every virtual account that gets created will be associated to a corporate Identity.

card_name.description: The name to appear on the card. If omitted then the card name will be composed by: <first_name><><last_name> or if abbreviation is needed <first letter of first_name><><last_name>. The field length can vary depending on the card design and is also restricted to a maximum of 21 if the provider is Marqeta.

deny_service.description: Comma separated list of services (authorisation transaction types) that should be denied for the card: 0 - Sale (Goods & services) 1 - Cash 9 - Sale with cashback Not available on all markets

card_visible_number.description: Characters showing part of the PAN (first 4 characters * last 4 characters)

bureau_del_bulk_code.description: Bureau specific bulk code used to group cards for bulk orders at the bureau. This code will appear on the delivered package.

card_sequence.description: If design of the card is asking for sequence, then a 3 digit number will be generated. This number is unique for any card of the card holder.

card_pan.description: 16 or 19 digit card number. Only in the response if the card is virtual and the client is authorised to receive this secure data.

card_exp_date.description: The expiry date of the card (format yyyy-mm-dd).

card_cvc2.description: The CVC2 number for the card. Only in the response if the card is virtual and the client is authorised to receive this secure data.

The field length can vary depending on the card design and is also restricted to a maximum of 21 if the provider is Marqeta.

post.summary: Provides a secured link to deliver virtual card details for a specific Ipv4 IP.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call provides a secure link.

action.description: - R: for retrieve - M: for modify (default is retrieve)

client_ip.description: IPV4 of the client. Format example a.b.c.d

secured_url.description: The link contains a secure token that will be useable just one time and will expire in the next 15 minutes. The server will only accept a connection from the client with the correct Ipv4. For R action, when you perform a HTTP GET from this URL, the JSON returned will return the PIN details in card_pin format. For M action, the PIN data must be posted to the URL in the format of card_pin.

post.summary: Retrieves the unencrypted "PIN code" via SMS to the specified mobile number. If no number is sent, the message would be sent to the card holder mobile registered at creation time.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call retrieves an unencrypted PIN code via SMS.

mobile_no.description: Mandatory for 3D- Secure e-commerce payments. Mobile number of the individual.

mobile_ext.description: Country Code extension for mobile telephone number.

post.summary: Returns the transaction information for a card.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call returns the transaction information for a card.

all_txns.description: 0 ; do not retrieve transactions with 99 status1 ; retrieve all transactions (even transaction with status 99)If not set, do not retrieve transactions with 99 status.

nb_txns.description: Number of the most recent transactions needed.If set, the selection window is not used.At least nb_txns or start_date must be provided.

country.description: Two-character ISO alphabetic code. Examples: FR / GB. If left blank, the country of the client will be used.

fx_rate.description: The FX rate expressed as amount/amount_billed

auth.description: Flag if the transaction has been authorised before the settlement.

type.description: The type of the transaction: 0: Internal 1: Purchase 2: ATM Cash 3: Cashback 4: Offline Balance Collection 5: ATM Balance 6: Purchase Reversal 7: ATM Reversal 8: TopUp 9: Transfer 10: Adjustment 11: Refund 12: Reimbursment

id.description: Unique id of the transaction. The transaction keeps this id all along its life. The other references can change depending on the status.

merchant_terminal_id.description: Merchant terminal code from ISO message

amount.description: Maximum limit amount for the corporate. Decimal separator "." (point). Thousand separator; none.

reject_description.description: In case of declined transaction, reject description if available.

status.description: The status of the transaction: 0: Pending 1: Settled 2: Declined 3: Reversal 4: Approved 5: Release 6: Dispute 99: Deleted

post.summary: Activates a previously ordered card, pn_card_order for details on how to order a card.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call activates a previously ordered card.

post.summary: Allows clients to verify the API availability, it does not provide status for the services behind the API. If the API is available, the response will be returned. If it is unavailable, the call will timeout.

post.summary: Retrieves the request and response of a client transaction based on a previous unique client_transac_id of the transaction.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call retrieves a client transaction request and response.

response_data.description: Escaped json with the request data of the call with client_transac_id_check in client_transac_id. If empty this call is still running.

request_data.description: Escaped json with the request data of the call with client_transac_id_check in client_transac_id

post.summary: For each call to the Bankable API, a client can optionally include a client_transac_id to uniquely identify the API call being made. Should you wish to reuse a client_transac_id, you will need to clear it as these IDs are unique and duplicates will be rejected.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call clears a client_transac_id in order for it to be reused.

corporate_client_code.description: The corporate client code (unique identifier) of the corporate.

country.description: Two-character ISO alphabetic code. Examples: FR / GB. If left blank, the country of the client will be used.

state.description: State, District or full Country name

country.description: Two-character ISO alphabetic code. Examples: FR / GB. If left blank, the country of the client will be used.

state.description: State, District or full Country name

corporate_client_code.description: The corporate client code (unique identifier) of the corporate.

corporate_families.description: Identifier for corporate hierarchies, under which a family of corporates has been created.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

kyb_status.description: KYB status of the corporate. Status can be 'Passed','Rejected' or 'Pending'.

amount.description: Maximum limit amount for the corporate. Decimal separator "." (point). Thousand separator; none.

funds_accepted.description: The total amount of the transactions that have been accepted during the period.

valid_to.description: Date until which the kyb limit is applied. Format yyyy-mm-dd.

funds_suspended.description: The total amount of the transactions that have been suspended during the period.

valid_from.description: Date from which the kyb limit is applied. Format yyyy-mm-dd.

post.summary: Set a corporates KYB status and risk level on the Bankable platform.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call set a corporates KYB status and risk level on the Bankable platform.

risk_level.description: The risk-level are; EDD Enhanced due diligence CDD Consumer due diligence SDD Simple due diligence - Mandatory if newly created Corporate

enable_outbound_payments.description: true â Make and receive false â Receive only

corporate_client_code.description: The corporate client code (unique identifier) of the corporate.

post.summary: The mandate information for a funding account, can be requested for a client (corporate or consumer).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call retrieves mandate information for a client.

active.description: If no present all mandates are returned irrespective of their state. True - return active mandates. False - return inactive mandates

funding_account_code.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

creditor_id.description: Unique identifier provided by the scheme for the creditor (direct debit collector)

mandate_type.description: Interbank mandate transport: CORE: SDD Core B2B: SDD B2B (Business Only) BACS: UK Direct Debit

creditor_name.description: Name of the direct debit collector

mandate_id.description: Unique identifier provided by the scheme for the mandates

active.description: If no present all mandates are returned irrespective of their state. True - return active mandates. False - return inactive mandates

post.summary: Request the refund of funds, collected by direct debit, up to 13 months after collection.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call requests a direct debit refund.

reject_reason.description: String describing why the refund request was rejected. E.g. "Mandate Not Found", "Transaction Not Found", "Transaction older than 13 months".

status.description: Indication of whether the request was valid (true) or invalid (false)

post.x-WM-CRUD_OPERATION_ID: BNKTransfer.direct debits (Coming to your Sandbox soon!)

post.summary: Refuse a direct debit collection request. A refusal must be recieved on the day before collection.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call refuses a direct debit collection.

reject_reason.description: String describing why the refund request was rejected. E.g. "Mandate Not Found", "Transaction Not Found", "Transaction older than 13 months".

status.description: Indication of whether the request was valid (true) or invalid (false)

parameters.description: A successful call exchange an amount of a currency from sell side virtual account to the currency of the buy side virtual account.

fix_leg.description: Leg of the exchange that should be fixed to the amount. Values include BUY or SELL

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call create a restricted region

parameters.description: A successful call assigns an additional consumer to an already created virtual account.

bic.description: The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.

ch_client_code.description: Unique identifier of a consumer. If this field is provided, the virtual account will be trated as a consumer account, belonging to a consumer of the corporation with provided corporate_id.

parameters.description: A successful call adds an authorised currency to an existing IBAN.

bic.description: The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

post.summary: Changes the profile associated with a multicurrency account (specified by IBAN). No changes are made to the profile during an upgrade.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call updates the profile associated with the multicurrency account.

bic.description: The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.

post.summary: Blocks a set of virtual accounts by BIC/IBAN and prevents them from being able to send/receive payments. Other functions are still allowed, based on the block type selected (i.e. BLI - BLO - BLK).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call blocks a set of virtual accounts by BIC/IBAN.

block_type.description: Represents the type of block to instate. Possible values are: BLI (Inbound Payments are blocked), BLO (Outbound Payments are blocked), BLK (Inbound and Outbound payments are blocked). If empty, block_type defaults to blocked).

bic.description: The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.
The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.

post.summary: Cancels a set of virtual accounts by BIC/IBAN and prevents them from being able to send/receive payments permanently. No further functions will be allowed on these accounts.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call cancels a set of virtual accounts by BIC/IBAN.

bic.description: The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.
The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.

post.summary: Unblocks a set of virtual accounts by BIC/IBAN and allows them to be able to send/receive payments. Other functions are still allowed, based on the block type selected (i.e. BLI - BLO - BLK).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call unblocks a set of virtual accounts by BIC/IBAN.

unblock_type.description: Represents the type of block to instate. Possible values are: BLI (Inbound Payments are blocked), BLO (Outbound Payments are blocked), BLK (Inbound and Outbound payments are blocked). If empty, block_type defaults to blocked).

bic.description: The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.
The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.

post.summary: Return the details of the specified profile (profile_code).

profile_code.description: Profile of limits, velocities, and fees of the virtual account. Not available on all packages.
Profile of limits, velocities, and fees of the virtual account. Not available on all packages.

profile_name.description: Profile name for the platform limits and fees.

profile_code.description: Profile of limits, velocities, and fees of the virtual account. Not available on all packages.
Profile of limits, velocities, and fees of the virtual account. Not available on all packages.

post.summary: Create a region constraint based on the list of countries specified by their 2-letter ISO code.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call creates a region.

country_list.description: Country list to be provided in ISO format separated by comma (,). Example FR,GB,NL.

region_code.description: Region code (group of countries) to which the limit rules are to be applied. Must be present if no country is specified.

post.summary: Retrieves the information of a previously created region, by region_name or region_code. NOTE: Using region_name may result in more than one set of region_information being returned.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call returns the information on a region.

country.description: Country to be provided in ISO format like FR,GB,NL.

region_code.description: Region code (group of countries) to which the limit rules are to be applied. Must be present if no country is specified.

post.summary: Retrieve a list of all inbound payments for a distributor that have been suspended for reasons such as - a KYB breach.

reference.description: Reference of the inbound suspended payment

country_code.description: Two-character ISO alphabetic code. Examples: FR / GB. If left blank, the country of the client will be used.

bic.description: The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.

post.summary: Assigns additional consumers to jointly own an already created consumer virtual account, specified by reference.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call assigns an additional consumer to an already created consumer virtual account.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

ch_client_code.description: Unique identifier of a consumer. If this field is provided, the virtual account will be trated as a consumer account, belonging to a consumer of the corporation with provided corporate_id.

post.summary: Creates a virtual account as either a corporate, or consumer account.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call creates an account belonging to a consumer within a corporate or directly to a corporate. To create a corporate account, the corporate_id of the desired corporate should be provided and the ch_client_code field should be left blank. In order to create a consumer account belonging to a consumer within a corporate, the corporate_id of the parent corporate and the ch_client_code should be provided. If no corporate_id is provided in either the creation of a corporate account or consumer account, the default corporate of the distributor will be assumed as the corporate owner of the virtual account.

package_code.description: The package that defines the payment schemes and limits for the account.

corporate_id.description: Corporate Identity. If set, the future virtual account will be attached to the corporate. Otherwise, it will be attached to the default coporate of the distributor. Every virtual account that gets created will be associated to a corporate Identity.

profile_code.description: Profile of limits, velocities, and fees of the virtual account. Not available on all packages.

ch_client_code.description: Unique identifier of a consumer. If this field is provided, the virtual account will be trated as a consumer account, belonging to a consumer of the corporation with provided corporate_id.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

ch_client_code.description: Unique identifier of a consumer. If this field is provided, the virtual account will be trated as a consumer account, belonging to a consumer of the corporation with provided corporate_id.

post.summary: List all current and settled transactions for a given period together with the opening and closing balance for that period.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call returns a statement of current and settled account activity.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

page_token.description: Token to be used to retrieve the next page.

max_page_size.description: Size of the page to be returned.

accountReference.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

nextPageToken.description: Token for accessing the next page of the statement

dateTime.description: Date and time, formatted yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.

country.description: Two-character ISO alphabetic code. Examples: FR / GB. If left blank, the country of the client will be used.

scheme.description: This is the payment scheme that governs the processing of operations. For faster payments, the key will be "FPS".

amount.description: Maximum limit amount for the corporate. Decimal separator "." (point). Thousand separator; none.

atmFeeAmount.description: The ATM fee amount settled in the account currency. ISO format currency amount. Number of decimal places is defined by the currency type may be between 0 and 4.

otherFeeAmount.description: The sum of all other fees settled in the account currency. ISO format currency amount. Number of decimal places is defined by the currency type may be between 0 and 4.

type.description: The type of the transaction: 0: Internal 1: Purchase 2: ATM Cash 3: Cashback 4: Offline Balance Collection 5: ATM Balance 6: Purchase Reversal 7: ATM Reversal 8: TopUp 9: Transfer 10: Adjustment 11: Refund 12: Reimbursment

ordererRef.description: External reference, assigned by the orderer, used to uniquely identify the order. This reference is transmitted throughout the entire payment circuit.

deviceType.description: The type of device into which the digital wallet token will be provisioned. Allowable values: MOBILE_PHONE, WATCH, TABLET

deviceName.description: Name of the device the token is linked to.

counterpartyBankAccountDetails.description: Counterparty banking details. Mandatory for âPayment Transactionsâ.

id.description: Unique id of the transaction. The transaction keeps this id all along its life. The other references can change depending on the status.

pendingTransactionCount.description: The number of pending transactions in the statement.

settledTransactionCount.description: The number of settled transactions in the statement.

dateTime.description: Date and time, formatted yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.

country.description: Two-character ISO alphabetic code. Examples: FR / GB. If left blank, the country of the client will be used.

scheme.description: This is the payment scheme that governs the processing of operations. For faster payments, the key will be "FPS".

type.description: The type of the transaction: 0: Internal 1: Purchase 2: ATM Cash 3: Cashback 4: Offline Balance Collection 5: ATM Balance 6: Purchase Reversal 7: ATM Reversal 8: TopUp 9: Transfer 10: Adjustment 11: Refund 12: Reimbursment

dateTime.description: Date and time, formatted yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.

amount.description: Maximum limit amount for the corporate. Decimal separator "." (point). Thousand separator; none.

ordererRef.description: External reference, assigned by the orderer, used to uniquely identify the order. This reference is transmitted throughout the entire payment circuit.

deviceType.description: The type of device into which the digital wallet token will be provisioned. Allowable values: MOBILE_PHONE, WATCH, TABLET

deviceName.description: Name of the device the token is linked to.

counterpartyBankAccountDetails.description: Counterparty banking details. Mandatory for âPayment Transactionsâ.

id.description: Unique id of the transaction. The transaction keeps this id all along its life. The other references can change depending on the status.

post.summary: Retrieves the account information and state of a virtual account.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call retrieves information on a virtual account and the account state.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

package_code.description: The package that defines the payment schemes and limits for the account.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

virtual_account_status.description: The status options are: - EXP: Expired - ACT: Active - CAN: Cancelled - BLK: Blocked from receiving inbound paments and from making outbound payments - BLI: Blocked from receiving inbound payments - BLO: Blocked from making outbound payments

ch_client_code.description: Unique identifier of a consumer. If this field is provided, the virtual account will be trated as a consumer account, belonging to a consumer of the corporation with provided corporate_id.

post.summary: Make outbound payments (to external accounts) for FPS and SEPA.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call makes an outbound payment.

account_number.description: UK account number for sending and recieving payments.

amount.description: Maximum limit amount for the corporate. Decimal separator "." (point). Thousand separator; none.

reference_issuer.description: Format of the structured reference. Default ISO.

beneficiary_reference.description: Communication text linked to the payment. Note that for SEPA payments, maximum length is 40 characters, or 35 for a structured reference.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

structured_reference.description: Set to "true" to use structured remittance information with a SEPA payment, or "false" to leave as unstructured.

sort_code.description: UK sort code for sending and recieving payments.

international_payment.description: If false, then the payment is treated as domestic and uses the following payment rails dependent on the currency: EUR - SEPA GBP - FPS USD - ACH If true, the payment is treated as international and uses SWIFT. The default is Domestic.

charging_option.description: Default - SHA - SHA - BEN - OUR If international_payment is not true then this value will be ignored

reference.description: Reference text linked to the payment.

country_code.description: Two-character ISO alphabetic code. Examples: FR / GB. If left blank, the country of the client will be used.

payment_purpose.description: String reporesenting the purpose of the payment

account_name.description: Concatenated name of the account holder. Generated from First and Last name of the account holder. This will be included in outbound payments instruction.

bic.description: The BIC code of the Bank where the account is held.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

post.summary: Change the profile associated with a card holder or account. No changes are made to the profile during an upgrade. All accumulators are reset during an upgrade.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call changes the profile associated with an account or card holder.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

ch_client_code.description: Unique identifier of a consumer. If this field is provided, the virtual account will be trated as a consumer account, belonging to a consumer of the corporation with provided corporate_id.

post.summary: Returns a list of all account activity for a given time window and/or a given number of transactions.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A successful call returns a statement of all account activity.

offset.description: Start of the selection entry. Statement will be ordered based on the operation date. If count provided, offset must be provided.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

count.description: Number of the selection entry. Statement will be ordered based on the operation date. If not set, the complete list will be retrieved. If offset is set, count will be effective.

amount.description: Maximum limit amount for the corporate. Decimal separator "." (point). Thousand separator; none.

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account

type.description: Entry Types: 0: Load 1: Unload Adjustment 2: Transfer 3: Fees 4: Card Fee 5: Transfer 6: Unload 7: Funding 8: Reimbursement 9: Dist card fees 10: Load Adjustment 11: Refund 12: Regularisation 13: Monthly fees 14: Annual fees 15: Fee Reversal 16: Card FX fees 19: sepa_transfer_out 20: Client Credit 21: Client Debit 22: Clearing 23: Distributor fee 24: Card Chargeback 25: Chargeback 26: Scheme payment 27: Interchange Received 28: Represent 29: Scheme clearing 30: Interchange Paid 31: Network Fees 32: Card Discharge 34: Block 35: Debit

recipient.description: For payments and transfers, this is the virtual account name. For card transactions, this is the card_client_code.

country.description: Two-character ISO alphabetic code. Examples: FR / GB. If left blank, the country of the client will be used.

fx_rate.description: The FX rate expressed as amount/amount_billed

auth.description: Flag if the transaction has been authorised before the settlement.

type.description: The type of the transaction: 0: Internal 1: Purchase 2: ATM Cash 3: Cashback 4: Offline Balance Collection 5: ATM Balance 6: Purchase Reversal 7: ATM Reversal 8: TopUp 9: Transfer 10: Adjustment 11: Refund 12: Reimbursment

id.description: Unique id of the transaction. The transaction keeps this id all along its life. The other references can change depending on the status.

merchant_terminal_id.description: Merchant terminal code from ISO message

amount.description: Maximum limit amount for the corporate. Decimal separator "." (point). Thousand separator; none.

reject_description.description: In case of declined transaction, reject description if available.

status.description: The status of the transaction: 0: Pending 1: Settled 2: Declined 3: Reversal 4: Approved 5: Release 6: Dispute 99: Deleted
Operation Status: 0: Pending 1: Commit 2: Processing 3: Refused 4: Canceled 5: Template 6: Failed 7: Bulk_Processing

virtual_account_ref.description: Reference ID of the virtual account
